name: Federation of European Movers Associations
legal: e.V. Association registered in the Register of Associations at the Court in Frankfurt/Main, Germany
membership:
IRU - International Road Transport Union
MPE - Mobility for Prosperity in Europe
goal:
FEDEMAC was founded in 1959 (originally CODEMAC). FEDEMAC was registered as an independent organisation on 01 January 1995. Today it represents the interests of around 2500 professional removal companies in 22 European countries.The Members of FEDEMAC are the National Removers Associations in each country or Direct Affiliate Members in those countries where a National Association does not yet exist or is not yet a Member of FEDEMAC.
FEDEMAC's main function is to coordinate national activities/interests at a European level. Much of this work is centred on representation at the European Parliament and the European Commission; liaising with other Trade Organisations such as IRU, WCO, UEAPME, TLN, FTA, MPE, BEUC etc., and; undertakingother activities at National and European level as appropriate.
FEDEMAC works continously towards harmonisation of working methods, quality standards, training and cooperation with the Moving Industry.
interests: Climate Action, Competition, Consumers, Customs, Economy, finance and the euro, Employment and Social Affairs, Environment, Single market, Taxation, Transport
euInitiatives:
Mobility Package
Working Time Regulation
VAT
Posted workers
Customs Clearance of Household Goods
Urban Mobility
Tolls and Road Charges
